title: Weierstrass point
summary: In mathematics, a Weierstrass point P {\displaystyle P} on a nonsingular algebraic curve C {\displaystyle C} defined over the complex numbers is a point such that there are more functions on C {\displaystyle C} , with their poles restricted to P {\displaystyle P} only, than would be predicted by the Riemannâ€“Roch theorem.
